TopicTitle: Kerbal Space Program Lands at SXSW Gaming Expo

Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/e3ea9407538ab3a382686c6794ce0104/tumblr_inline_n1u8x13TQV1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><span>We’re thrilled to announce our participation in several key events at this weekend’s*</span><strong>SXSW</strong><span>*Gaming expo in Austin, TX.</span><br/><br/><span>First and foremost will be a panel taking place on Saturday afternoon where*</span><strong>Squad</strong><span>*developers and members of*</span><strong>NASA</strong><span>*will get together to talk about*</span><strong><em>Kerbal Space Program: Asteroid Redirect Mission</em></strong><span>. The much anticipated free content pack is based on a long term, real life*</span><strong>NASA</strong><span>*project which aims to save the planet by learning how to redirect asteroids away from it. More info on the panel and details on the free*</span><strong><em>Asteroid Redirect Mission</em></strong><span>*will be revealed this week.</span><br/><br/><span>We’re also excited to announce our participation in the*</span><strong>SXSW LANfest</strong><span>, sponsored by*</span><strong>Intel</strong><span>. They’ll be hosting a*</span><strong><em>Kerbal Space Program</em></strong><span>*tournament on Saturday evening that will have competitors scrambling into the stars, as they will have to conduct several missions on the spot - no prep time allowed. Play for fun, great prizes and the chance to show your skills off to members of*</span><strong>Squad</strong><span>, live and in person. More details on the*</span><strong><em>Kerbal Space Program</em></strong><span>*tournament at*</span><strong>LANfest</strong><span>*can be found here:*</span><strong><a href="http://intel.ly/1gLnfV5" target="_blank"><a href="http://intel.ly/1gLnfV5">http://intel.ly/1gLnfV5</a></a></strong><span>.</span><br/><br/><span>For anyone who can’t make it to*</span><strong>SXSW</strong><span>, we’ll keep you up to date news on the latest happenings. For those of you who will be down there, don’t be afraid to say hello. We’d love to see as many of you as we can.</span></p>
Yay! More details on the NASA collab! Woo! 0.24 will be the best update for me yet!
I hope it will be recorded, because I might not be able to get in! However, I fully intend to be at the LANfest tourney!
I'm stuck in Europe so it's not really an option for me

Thanks for the info, but you really should exercise some restraint when using bold tags

Online Technical Writing: Highlighting & Emphasis

Overkill. Emphasis techniques can be used in excess---the text swarms with a dizzying array of bold, italics, alternate fonts, caps, color.

why can't they ever host these awsome thingies in eastern Canada .. (more east than Montreal)

on the other hand......

KSP FTW,

and i'd like to ask if the asteroid NASA plans to captured is this one : http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2006_RH120

through temporary capture, this is currently our "second moon" although only for ~11 months at a time and only once every ~20 years.....

does NASA plan to capture this one permanently ?

Damn Sweden's distance from the US!

EDIT: But... What about Modding Monday?
yeah i live in Texas near Austin... Oh wait i am still in high school and my parents don't approve of me "wasting time" with KSP .... Dang
Trying to decide if I should reserve a seat or not.

yeah i live in Texas near Austin... Oh wait i am still in high school and my parents don't approve of me "wasting time" with KSP .... Dang

Please tell me you'll be doing a live streaming!?!
Is there a livestream for this? If so, somebody please post the link! Thanks!

So errm, do we that couldn't cross the globe to attend the event get access to any of this information? It's nice that you attend cons and all, but the amount of people that can visit you at a con is tiny compared to the number of people you can reach online, and frankly squad has pretty much vanished from the internet for over a week now with no info about anything forthcoming, we know vague outlines about some future content coming at some point but we haven't actually gotten details or seen any of it.
